
## Hashy Birthday

Visualisation of what the birthday option does with debug.

In this example, the birthday was 03011030

```
$ python hash.py --birthday

About to do 5 thing(s).
6ba234345ac7074625ab6b8dbbdbafb1 e00f458d47fa306fa81128345bcfad109f83081a10c483b1e99d91b287afc4e5
```

## That example turned out to be fairly to acheive, so extending the birthday

Now, the birthday is a bunch of repeating 02s.

```
About to do 5 thing(s).
WAMOO:  5
Seed:   0aea06713d80c36bbaa6efe430bedbcf
Hash:   020201d3fb466cef8ed982ae459a6638d013758526eb0ff44543e23c60a29391
Time:   1.5940227508544922
WAMOO:  5
Seed:   17f16a58ece7b125594dd0f0c700f4d7
Hash:   020207842c823757382d90b821df255404183434e35df8cd405d867ba7d722e7
Time:   16.879048824310303
WAMOO:  5
Seed:   08566be4dc5fcc02b6125f49ee590837
Hash:   0202082db484e470db80206ce576dff29a2aa236b2177f9bac2b52ea9efab639

WAMOO:  5

Time:   28.482215404510498
```

Look for big ones in the logs with: `r'WAMOO:\s+[1,6-9]'`


#### Specs For This Test

i5-3570k @ 4.11 GHz (89% usage)
